curated_text: Symbol: ABBV. Year: 2022. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the California Business and Professions Code, AndroGel, King Drug Co., Florence, Inc., Solvay Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Abbott, sham litigation, Perrigo Company, Abbott’s, Perrigo, The United States Court of Appeals, the Third Circuit, Humira, Adalimumab, Antitrust Litigation, the United States Court of Appeals, the Seventh Circuit, Forest Laboratories, LLC, Forest, Namenda, Allergan Inc., the U.S. Patent Office and Food and Drug Administration, Restasis, Bystolic Antitrust Litigation, MDL, National Prescription Opiate Litigation, State of New Mexico, Balderas v. AbbVie Inc., New Mexico’s Unfair Practices Act, the New Mexico False Advertising Act, Shareholder and Securities Litigation, Elliott Associates, Illinois Circuit Court, Shire, the Illinois Appellate Court, the New York Supreme Court, the Supreme Court of New York, Appellate Division, Holwill, Delaware Chancery Court, Allergan plc Securities Litigation, Nakata, the Food and Drug Administration’s, Treppel Family Trust, the U.S. Patent Office, Intellectual Property Litigation Pharmacyclics LLC, Alvogen Pine Brook LLC, AbbVie Inc., Reddy’s Laboratories, Ltd., Reddy’s Laboratories, Alembic Pharmaceuticals Ltd., Alembic Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Alembic Global Holdings SA, Genentech, Inc., Venclexta, CODM, Hematologic Oncology Imbruvica, 647 Total, Neuroscience, Vraylar United States, Eye Care Lumigan/Ganfort United States, Linzess/Constella United, ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION, the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, Supplementary Data, North Atlantic Treaty Organization, Botox, COVID-19, Research and Development Research, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, FDA, the European Medicines Agency’s, EMA, Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use, Crohn, bVie, the European Commission, EC, the European Medicines Agency, JAK, U-Excel, Rinvoq, TNF, U-ENDURE, New Drug Application, MAA, Breakthrough Therapy Designation, Imbruvica •, the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, NCCN, CLL, Genmab A/S (Genmab, DuoBody-CD3xCD20, Percent, United States, Imbruvica, Botox Cosmetic, Juvederm Collection, Botox Therapeutic, SG&A, litigation reserve, Research and Development, Syndesi Therapeutics SA, TeneoOne, Teneobio, Inc., BCMA, the Calico Life Sciences, Non-Operating Expenses (Income, LIQUIDITY, Credit Risk AbbVie. Context excerpt: competition provision of the California Business and Professions Code seeking injunctive relief, restitution, civil penalties and attorneys’ fees. In August 2019, direct purchasers of AndroGel filed a lawsuit, King Drug Co. of Florence, Inc., et al. v. AbbVie Inc., et al., against AbbVie and others in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania, alleging that 2006 patent litigation settlements and related agreements by Solvay Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (a company Abbott acquired in February 2010 and now known as AbbVie Products LLC) with three generic companies violated federal antitrust law, and also alleging that 2011 patent litigation by Abbott with two generic companies regarding AndroGel was sham litigation and the settlements of those litigations violated federal antitrust law. Plaintiffs generally seek monetary damages and/or injunctive relief and attorneys’ fees. In May 2020, Perrigo Company and related entities filed a lawsuit against AbbVie and others
